Methods

(static) getScript(url) → {Promise}

A method to load a javascript file onto your page
Parameters:
Name Type Description
url string Url to the java script file you want to load
Source:
  • utils.js, line 135
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves when the file is done loading
Type
Promise
Example
function doMyStuff() { };
var momentjsUrl = "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/moment.js/2.13.0/moment.min.js"
SPScript.utils.getScript(momentjsUrl).then(doMyStuff);

(static) getScripts(urls) → {Promise}

A method to load a javascript file onto your page
Parameters:
Name Type Description
urls Array.<string> An Array of urls to javascript files you want to load on your page
Source:
  • utils.js, line 119
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves when all the files are done loading
Type
Promise
Example
function doMyStuff() { };
var momentjsUrl = "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/moment.js/2.13.0/moment.min.js"
var jQueryUrl = "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.3/jquery.min.js"
SPScript.utils.getScript([momentjsUrl, jQueryUrl]).then(doMyStuff);

(static) parseJSON(data) → {object}

If you pass in string, it will try to run JSON.parse(). The SPScript get() and post() methods already run the response through this method, so you'd really only need this if you are doing a manual ajax request. Different browsers handle JSON response differently so it is safest to call this method if you aren't going through SPScript.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
data string Raw response from JSON request
Source:
  • utils.js, line 5
Returns:
- JSON parsed object. Returns null if JSON.parse fails
Type
object
Example
dao.executeRequest('/web/contentTypes')
		.then(SPScript.utils.parseJSON)
		.then(function(data) { console.log(data.d.results)})

(static) validateNamespace(namespace) → {Bool}

A method to check if a given namespace is on the global object (window).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
namespace string A global namespace
Source:
  • utils.js, line 95
Returns:
- True or False if the namespace is on the page
Type
Bool
Example
var canUseModals = SPScript.utils.validateNamespace("SP.UI.Dialog");

(static) validateODataV2(data) → {object}

Helps parse raw json response to remove ceremonious OData data.d namespace. Tries JSON.parse() and then pulling out actual result from data.d or data.d.results
Parameters:
Name Type Description
data string | object Raw response from JSON request
Source:
  • utils.js, line 27
Returns:
- JSON parsed object with that removes data.d OData structure
Type
object
Example
dao.get('/web/contentTypes')
		.then(SPScript.utils.validateODataV2)
		.then(function(contentTypes) { console.log(contentTypes)})

(static) waitForLibraries(namespaces) → {Promise}

A method to allow you to wait for script dependencies to load.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
namespaces Array An array of global namespaces, things on the global 'window'. For example, when jQuery is on the page, window.jQuery is valid. So 'jQuery' is the namespace.
Source:
  • utils.js, line 68
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves when all your namespaces are on the page
Type
Promise
Example
function doMyStuff() { };
SPScript.utils.waitForLibraries(["jQuery", "SP.UI.Dialog"]).then(doMyStuff);

(static) waitForLibrary(namespace) → {Promise}

A method to allow you to wait for a single script dependency to load.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
namespace string A global namespace. For example, when jQuery is on the page, window.jQuery is valid. So 'jQuery' is the namespace.
Source:
  • utils.js, line 82
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves when all your namespace is on the page
Type
Promise
Example
function doMyStuff() { };
SPScript.utils.waitForLibrary("jQuery").then(doMyStuff);
